availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, minister. Married to Mary Jane Rodgers on June 16, 1840. Father of Archie H. Dickerson, Mary B. Dickerson, Edwin Dickerson, Rose Dickerson, and Florence Dickerson. Minister in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Warren County, June 16, 1840 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), [Population/Slave] Schedules, [State], [County], [District 1], p. 843.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren, Bowling Green, p. 12.
Find A Grave, "Rev Archer C. Dickerson (December 18, 1806-December 21, 1891)," Memorial # 116839401, http://www.findagrave.com/ https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/116839401#source (accessed April 4, 2018).
